intro: Byrsanthes, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy yellow or white flower heads. The leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine, silvery down, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments. The flowers are often borne in clusters at the ends of the stems, adding ornamental value to the plant. Byrsanthes species are native to southern Africa and are adapted to grow in dry, rocky soils.
